head.title: World Briefing | Europe: 2003 Summer Was Hottest In 500 Years

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: 2003 Summer Was Hottest In 500 Years

abstract.p: Swiss scientists report findings in journal Science that show Europe's record heat wave last summer as part of three-decade-long warm period unprecendented over past 500 years; climate experts predict warming trend will continue (S)

block.p: The heat wave that scorched Europe last summer was part of a three-decade-long warm period on the continent that was ''very likely unprecedented for more than the past 500 years,'' Swiss scientists are reporting in the current issue of the journal Science. Their study also showed that European summers since 1994 were the hottest consecutive string of summers in the same span. The researchers did not speculate on the cause, and other climate experts said the warming was likely to continue.
